benchmark_details.name: HEALTH -PARIKSHA
benchmark_details.overview: This study provides an extensive assessment of 24 LLMs on real world data collected from Indian patients interacting with a medical chatbot in Indian English and 4 other Indic languages. It evaluates LLM responses on four metrics curated for healthcare applications, establishing leaderboards for each metric.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To conduct a comprehensive assessment of multilingual models within a real-world healthcare context.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The volume of non-English queries is significantly lower than that of English queries, meaning the results on non-English queries should not be considered definitive.

data.source: Dataset curated from questions sent to HEALTH BOT from patients scheduled for cataract surgery.
data.size: 749 question and ground truth answer pairs
data.annotation: Questions and responses were reviewed and validated by medical professionals.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing LLM responses with ground-truth responses and assessing coherence and conciseness based on specific evaluation criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Scores range from 0 to 2, evaluating response quality based on specific metrics.
methodology.validation: Validated by comparing LLM outputs with expert-verified ground truth responses.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All patient data was anonymized, and ethics approval was granted for the study.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent was obtained from patients and their family members before participation.
